ygData.subject: Re: [gladiator] Re: Scenario Editor information, specs, features, etc.    - all in one spot.
ygData.msgSnippet: Heya, ... I agree, you have generated a lot of conversation recently, and shown that everyone still reads the list :) I hope we get lots of ideas and thoughts

Heya,
> Only limitations I request is we don't deal with part 4 yet at this
> point: what we would love to see Gladiator:Beoyond Freedom do.  Beyond
> that, talk about Parts 1-3 is encouraged.
>
> The point of multiple parts is to keep discussion going at a steady
> pace [If it was just one giant wish list for everything, conversation
> probably would have died out by now].  When I switch to a higher part
> number, it means that I thought conversation about the current part
> was almost dead and I attempted to keep the mailing list active again
> by starting the next part.  So far, my strategy has been working for
> bringing this mailing list to a more active state.  In fact, we have
> surpassed previous records for number posts in a month at yahoo.
> Frankly, I hope discussion about part 4 will drag on and on and on and
> on and on and on and on and on and on and on and on and on . . .
I agree, you have generated a lot of conversation recently, and shown that
everyone still reads the list :)
I hope we get lots of ideas and thoughts on part 4 when it's turn arrives,
and I do think it will go on for a while, especially as all the previous
parts can also provide ideas and topics for it.

> BTW, if someone
> wants to bring something else up, feel free.  My goal is to keep this
> list somewhat active.
You're doing a great job!

> Also a reminder:  15 people need to show interest in a tournament
> before I will start work on that.  I have asked Tom Ricket to put
> something on the FSGames website about a possible tournament.
I'll be talking to a friend of mine and see if he wants to make a 2-man
team, I originally pucrhased gladiator because of it's multiplayer on a
single machine capabilities - those seem to be exceptionally difficult to
locate on the 'net :)
Unfortunately that was a few years ago and things have moved on (for a start
I've now got a small LAN :) and he may not have the time, we'll see though.
At any rate I can help with checking submitted games for cheating.

> One more requested feature:
>
> Search and replace objects.  Sometimes, I decide my opponents are
> either too weak or too strong and it would be very convient if I do a
> quick update on experience levels without having to delete lots of
> characters.
Added, there's an extra feature that goes with this which I saw in the
Serious Sam editor (if you want to see one hell of an editor, it's it, as a
bonus the game rocks too :) where you can clone objects, so say you could
use a bunch of identical enemy mages and if you changed one you could hit a
button to change all the clones as well.
Sound useful? :)

- Deathifier
